p: Table 1 summarizes the clinical data of all the patients involved in this study. Protein samples of the non-shock and shock groups were run on 2-DE gels, and each sample was run at least three times to ensure reproducibility. For the non-shock group, an average of 645 ± 45 spots was obtained ( Fig. 1A). For those of the shock group, 704 ± 84 spots were obtained ( Fig. 1B), indicating no difference in spot count between the two groups ( p > 0.05). Up- and down-regulation in the shock group was defined with a fold change cutoff value of 2.0 in comparison with the non-shock group. Eight protein spots with differential levels were statistically significant at p < 0.01, including spots 10, 19, 2, 24, 31, 26, 9 and 30 ( Fig. 2).
